trans-unit.source: Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Point in Time Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Point in Time Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database has built-in backups to support self-service Point in Time Restore for Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database has built-in backups to support self-service Point in Time Restore for Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Point in Time Restore creates a new database.
trans-unit.target: Point in Time Restore creates a new database.

trans-unit.source: The service automatically selects the service tier based on the backup used at the restore point.
trans-unit.target: The service automatically selects the service tier based on the backup used at the restore point.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have available quota on the logical server to create another database.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have available quota on the logical server to create another database.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to request an increased quota, contact <linkText>Azure Support</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to request an increased quota, contact <linkText>Azure Support</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You must use certificate based authentication to run the following cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: You must use certificate based authentication to run the following cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the Use the certificate method section in How to install and configure Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the Use the certificate method section in How to install and configure Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Get the database you want to restore by using the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabase</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Get the database you want to restore by using the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabase</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: ServerName where the database is located.
trans-unit.target: ServerName where the database is located.

trans-unit.source: DatabaseName of the database you want to restore.
trans-unit.target: DatabaseName of the database you want to restore.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>$Database = Get-AzureSqlDatabase -ServerName "myserver" –DatabaseName “mydb”
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>$Database = Get-AzureSqlDatabase -ServerName "myserver" –DatabaseName “mydb”

trans-unit.source: Begin the restore by using the <linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Begin the restore by using the <linkText>Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: SourceDatabase you want to restore from.
trans-unit.target: SourceDatabase you want to restore from.

trans-unit.source: TargetDatabaseName of the database you are restoring to.
trans-unit.target: TargetDatabaseName of the database you are restoring to.

trans-unit.source: PointInTime you want to restore to.
trans-unit.target: PointInTime you want to restore to.

trans-unit.source: Store what is returned to a variable called $RestoreRequest.
trans-unit.target: Store what is returned to a variable called $RestoreRequest.

trans-unit.source: This variable contains the restore request ID which is used for monitoring the status of a restore.
trans-unit.target: This variable contains the restore request ID which is used for monitoring the status of a restore.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>$RestoreRequest = Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore -SourceDatabase $Database –TargetDatabaseName “myrestoredDB” –PointInTime “2015-01-01 06:00:00”
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>$RestoreRequest = Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRestore -SourceDatabase $Database –TargetDatabaseName “myrestoredDB” –PointInTime “2015-01-01 06:00:00”

trans-unit.source: A restore may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: A restore may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: To monitor the status of the restore, use the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation</linkText><title></title> cmdlet and specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: To monitor the status of the restore, use the <linkText>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation</linkText><title></title> cmdlet and specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: ServerName of the database you are restoring to.
trans-unit.target: ServerName of the database you are restoring to.

trans-unit.source: OperationGuid which is the Restore Request ID that was stored in the $RestoreRequest variable in Step 2.
trans-unit.target: OperationGuid which is the Restore Request ID that was stored in the $RestoreRequest variable in Step 2.

trans-unit.source: PS C:\>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation –ServerName "myserver" –OperationGuid $RestoreRequest.RequestID
trans-unit.target: PS C:\>Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation –ServerName "myserver" –OperationGuid $RestoreRequest.RequestID

trans-unit.source: The State and PercentComplete fields show the status of the restore.
trans-unit.target: The State and PercentComplete fields show the status of the restore.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Business Continuity</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Business Continuity</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Point in Time Restore (blog)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Point in Time Restore (blog)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
